perturbation.original_text: Payment of the Fees shall be due and payable within ten (10) days of the date of the invoice. All or any portion of the Fees not paid when due shall bear interest at the rate of one and one-half (1.5%) per month, calculated from the date such payment is due until the date on which such payment is made, inclusive; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, that if such interest rate exceeds the amount allowed by applicable law, then the interest rate shall be adjusted to reflect the maximum amount allowed by such applicable law.
perturbation.changed_text: Payment of the Fees shall be due and payable within sixty (60) days of the date of the invoice. All or any portion of the Fees not paid when due shall bear interest at the rate of twenty-five percent (25%) per month, calculated from the date such payment is due until the date on which such payment is made, inclusive; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, that if such interest rate exceeds the amount allowed by applicable law, then the interest rate shall be adjusted to reflect the maximum amount allowed by such applicable law.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides for payment within 10 days, which is a reasonable business practice. This is modified to 60 days. This change could create inconsistency because the standard business practice for invoice payments may require shorter payment terms. Furthermore, the imposition of 25% monthly interest, even with the caveat about legal limits, introduces a high, potentially usurious interest rate, creating a legal contradiction if the applicable state law has usury laws that cap interest rates at a lower level.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State Usury Laws (e.g., Colorado Revised Statutes ยง 5-12-103 which sets limits on interest rates)

perturbation.original_text: Reseller shall report promptly to TouchStar all claimed or suspected defects in the TouchStar Software or Support Services and shall notify TouchStar in writing of any claim or proceeding involving the TouchStar Software or Support Services within five (5) days after Reseller learns of the claim or proceeding.
perturbation.changed_text: Reseller shall report promptly to TouchStar all claimed or suspected defects in the TouchStar Software or Support Services and shall notify TouchStar in writing of any claim or proceeding involving the TouchStar Software or Support Services within one (1) day after Reseller learns of the claim or proceeding.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires the reseller to notify TouchStar within 5 days of any claim or proceeding. The modified text changes this to 1 day. One (1) day is an unreasonably short time frame which may not be adequate for a party to assess the situation and contact legal counsel. It potentially conflicts with the legal principle of 'reasonable notice' and creates an unconscionable burden on the Reseller, particularly if the claim involves complex legal issues requiring more time for review. If the reseller fails to comply they may be penalized.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Legal principle of 'reasonable notice' and implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing

perturbation.original_text: At a minimum, Reseller will subscribe for and maintain during the Term and for a period of two (2) years thereafter, commercial general liability insurance and errors and omission insurance in minimum amounts of Two Million Dollars (US$2,000,000) per occurrence. Reseller will cause its insurance agent or broker to issue and deliver to TouchStar certified copies of certificates evidencing that insurance coverage of the required types and limits are in full force and effect. Reseller will ensure that any persons or entities engaged by or employed by it will carry and maintain such insurance coverage. Each policy will include a provision requiring notice to the other party at least thirty (30) days prior to any cancellation, non-renewal, or material modification of the policy and will require that each policy will name TouchStar as an additional insured.
perturbation.changed_text: At a minimum, Reseller will subscribe for and maintain during the Term and for a period of one (1) year thereafter, commercial general liability insurance and errors and omission insurance in minimum amounts of Two Million Dollars (US$2,000,000) per occurrence. Reseller will cause its insurance agent or broker to issue and deliver to TouchStar certified copies of certificates evidencing that insurance coverage of the required types and limits are in full force and effect. Reseller will ensure that any persons or entities engaged by or employed by it will carry and maintain such insurance coverage. Each policy will include a provision requiring notice to the other party at least ten (10) days prior to any cancellation, non-renewal, or material modification of the policy and will require that each policy will name TouchStar as an additional insured.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires the reseller to maintain insurance for two years after the term, and to provide 30 days notice before insurance changes. The modified text changes this to one year, and ten days notice. Some states may require a minimum of 30 days' notice to affected parties (like TouchStar) prior to any insurance policy cancellation, non-renewal, or material modification to allow them sufficient time to secure alternative coverage. Furthermore, the one-year requirement following the term could be too short and may conflict with indemnification obligations that could remain in effect longer.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State Insurance Regulations regarding cancellation/non-renewal notice periods.
